title: Sum individual demand curves to get market demand

content.description: The graphs above show the individual demand curves for the only two consumers, Adey and Sarah, in the market for popcorn.
content.question: As the price of popcorn decreases from <math alttext="$12" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>$</mi> <mn>12</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> to <math alttext="$6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, how does the quantity demanded change along the market demand curve?

choices.label: It increases from <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units.
It increases from <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units.
It increases from <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units.
It increases from <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="14" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units.
It increases from <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="14" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units.

content.answer: It increases from <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units.
